Expenses kr The costs are a sum of your energy costs, your car fuel costs and the fixed costs your car produces, like insurance and value depreciation.
Calories kCal Your calorie consumption. The more you walk or cycle instead of driving, the more you will burn.
Energy consumption kWh The total amount of energy/heat your house needs in kWh. The outside temperature determines how much heat you will need to keep it warm.
Driving distance km This is the average distance you have driven in the given period.

Carbon footprint
Transportation
Energy consumption
The type of energy you use for heating and the efficiency of your heating system determine 80% of your carbon footprint from energy consumption. The building year and the year of the last renovation of the house, also affects the housing emissions. Your vehicle is a major source of greenhouse gas emissions. Cycling or walking instead of driving will save you money, give you health benefits, and reduce your carbon footprint. Finally, to monitor your health gains
Home Screen NEXT SKIP GOT IT
Welcome! The goal of this app is to make you more aware of how your daily habits and energy use affect the environment. The Earth is happy when you have a carbon footprint below 4 kgCO₂ per day. If you cross the limit of 4 kgCO₂, the EarthÂ´s mood and health changes accordingly.
The app does this by tracking your movement and automatically detectign whether you walk, cycle or drive a car. If the app detects that you are driving, the CO₂ emission from the drive is calculated.
The app also checks the outside temperature where you live and calculates how much energy is needed to heat your home and how much CO₂ are emitted to produce this amount of energy, based on heating type you have in your home.
The emissions from transportation and heating are added to calculate your carbon footprint. This is visualized in the circular indicator around the Earth on the dashboard.
There are many benefits of choosing green transportation types to reduce your carbon footprint. In addition to help save the planet and meet the 2 degree goal of the United Nation, you can save money, and gain health benefits if you choose to walk or cycle instead of driving.
You can also reduce your emissions by changing to an electric car, or by installing a solar panel to provide your house with energy. Estimate how much you can save by clicking the estimation buttons at the bottom of the screen on the dashboard.
Collect points by making green choices.
Connect with your neighbors and friends, and challenge each other on who can reduce their carbon footprint the most.
See your historic data and check to see if you change your behavior, or just to see how your emissions change throughout the day, week or month.
Connect, compete, and take action with your friends, family and neighbors. Together we can build a healthier, happier planet!
